description: This course provides a sequential introduction to physical chemistry. Beginning with an
introduction to statistical aspects of chemical equilibria, it explores the relationships
between energy, entropy and equilibria (thermodynamics); oxidation-reduction reactions
and electrochemistry; transitions between phases; and rates of reactions. Students attend
three classes and one three-hour laboratory per week. Offered annually during spring
122, and concurrent or previous enrollment in MATH 119 or MATH 120, or
fullname: Energies and Rates of Chemical Reactions
